Class ServerCommunicator

  • java.lang.Object

      • com.ServerCommunicator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Communicator, java.lang.Runnable

    public class ServerCommunicator
extends AbstractCommunicator

      Closes the socket, nullifies it and nullifies the in/output-streams.
      protected void connectSocket()
      Does the necessary setup for the sockets to establish a connection.
      protected void handleDisconnect()

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerCommunicator

        public ServerCommunicator(int port)
        Creates a ServerCommunicator acting on the specified port.
        Parameters:
        port - the port that the server listens on

    • Method Detail

      • handleDisconnect

        protected void handleDisconnect()
        We do want the server to keep looking for a connection when a disconnect happens. Therefore, clear previous connection and keep connecting in mainloop.
        Specified by:
        handleDisconnect in class AbstractCommunicator

      • clearConnection

        protected void clearConnection()
        Description copied from class: AbstractCommunicator
        Closes the socket, nullifies it and nullifies the in/output-streams. This is necessary because one communicator acts as a server and the other one as a client.
        Specified by:
        clearConnection in class AbstractCommunicator

      • connectSocket

        protected void connectSocket()
                      throws java.net.SocketTimeoutException
        Description copied from class: AbstractCommunicator
        Does the necessary setup for the sockets to establish a connection. This is necessary because one communicator needs to act as a server and the other one as a client.
        Specified by:
        connectSocket in class AbstractCommunicator
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketTimeoutException - thrown if the socket is not connected in a certain time span
